DOC.brief_summary: This prospective randomized , double-blind , placebo-controlled study subject disable migraine ( Migraine Disability Assessment ( MIDAS ) score ≥ 11 ) .
DOC.brief_title: Lasmiditan Compared Placebo Acute Treatment Migraine :
DOC.detailed_description: Subjects ask treat migraine attack study drug outpatient basis . Subjects provide dose card contain dose initial treatment second dose use rescue recurrence migraine . Each subject 's study participation consist screen visit ( Visit 1 ) telephone contact within 7 day confirm eligibility , Treatment Period 8 week , End-of-Study ( EoS ) visit ( Visit 2 ) within one week ( 7 day ) treat single migraine attack . The total time study approximately 11 week .
DOC.criteria: Able willing give write informed consent . Patients migraine without aura fulfil International Headache Society ( IHS ) diagnostic criterion 1.1 1.2.1 ( International Headache Classification ( ICHD ) 2004 ) . History disable migraine least 1 year . MIDAS score ≥11 . Migraine onset age 50 year . History 3 8 migraine attack per month ( < 15 headache day per month ) . Male female , age 18 year . Females childbearing potential must use willing use highly effective form contraception ( e.g . combine oral contraceptive , intrauterine device ( IUD ) , abstinence vasectomized partner ) . Able willing complete electronic diary . Pregnant breastfeed woman . Women childbearing potential use willing use highly effective contraception . Known coronary artery disease , clinically significant arrhythmia uncontrolled hypertension . History evidence hemorrhagic stroke , epilepsy condition place subject increase risk seizure . History recurrent dizziness and/or vertigo include benign paroxysmal positional vertigo ( BPPV ) , Meniere 's disease , vestibular migraine , vestibular disorder . History diabetes mellitus complication ( diabetic retinopathy , nephropathy neuropathy ) . History within previous three year current evidence abuse drug , prescription illicit , alcohol . History orthostatic hypotension syncope . Significant renal hepatic impairment . Subject imminent risk suicide ( positive response question 4 5 CSSRS ) suicide attempt within six month prior screen visit . Known Hepatitis B C HIV infection . History , within past 12 month , chronic migraine form primary secondary chronic headache disorder ( e.g . hemicrania continuum , medication overuse headache ) headache frequency great 15 headache day per month . Use 3 dos per month either opiates barbiturate . Initiation change concomitant medication reduce frequency migraine episode within three ( 3 ) month prior Screening/Visit 1 .
